jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Applied AI
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Mainstay

Mainstay is the leading market intelligence platform purpose built for buying, managing, and selling homes in the single family rental industry. As an AI native company, we turn complex data into clarity that helps the industry move forward with confidence. Founded within Opendoor, Mainstay launched as an independent company in 2024 and recently raised a Series A round led by Khosla Ventures.

Ready to shape the future of real estate with AI? Join Mainstay and help us redefine what’s possible in the single family rental space. If you thrive on solving complex problems and want to make a tangible impact in a fast-growing industry, we’d love to hear from you - apply now and let’s move the industry forward, together!

About the role

What you should expect as a full-stack senior software engineer - maximum agency, tight feedback loops with customers, and no shortage of product challenges that directly translate to business value! You’ll have the opportunity to design, build, and ship complex AI-powered workflow management systems and tools that enable our operations team to execute at scale.

We’re looking for someone who can both fine-tune and optimize models and ship reliable, production ready AI features end to end - from retrieval pipelines and guardrails to backend systems and user facing product experiences.

Our products are built with Python, Typescript, and React on AWS.

What you'll do

In this role, you’ll be responsible for both shaping new AI-powered product experiences and ensuring they’re reliable at scale. That means fine-tuning and optimizing models for our domain, designing retrieval pipelines and guardrails, and building the backend systems that make these features production-ready. You’ll work closely with product managers, designers, and operators to bring AI features from idea to launch, balancing innovation with stability.

In this role, you will:

  • Contribute to all phases of product development, from ideation and prototyping to implementation and iteration

  • Build and evolve both frontend product experiences and backend services that power them

  • Fine-tuning existing models and optimize their performance for Mainstay use cases

  • Design reliable, scalable backend services to support AI-powered features in production

  • Leverage AI to modernize and automate legacy workflows in the real estate industry

  • Evaluate and benchmark LLM performance across latency, cost, accuracy, and hallucination rates

  • Tune prompts, chain-of-thought logic, and implement retrieval strategies such as RAG and vector stores

  • Monitor performance, safety, and cost of LLM-driven features in production environments

  • Define and build useful LLM-powered experiences in partnership with cross-functional teams

  • Mentor and support the growth of other engineers on the team

  • Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and operators to identify and solve customer pain points

What we're looking for

  • 5+ years of experience building and delivering production-grade software, ideally in fast-paced, high-growth startup environment

  • At least 3 years of hands-on experience developing and deploying production-ready AI features (LLM applications, fine-tuning, RAG systems, guardrails, evals, etc.)

  • Strong full-stack engineering skills with a focus on backend scalability and system reliability

  • Experience fine-tuning and deploying LLMs

  • Deep understanding of LLM evaluation methods, including prompt testing, retrieval precision, hallucination detection, and cost/performance tradeoffs

  • Experience building custom eval pipelines using techniques like model-as-a-judge or embedding similarity

  • Hands-on work with agentic frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, AutoGen, CrewAI) or custom agent systems

  • Strong full-stack engineering skills with a focus on scalable systems and adaptability

  • Clear, concise communicator - essential for our remote, highly collaborative team

  • Proactive and ownership-driven - comfortable navigating ambiguity and shifting priorities

  • Customer-focused mindset with a drive to build solutions that solve real problems

  • Experience with AI/ML tools or APIs; bonus if you’ve worked with Python-based RAG, voice agents, or AI task automation

Bonus points if

  • Experience working with retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) pipelines

  • Exposure to building or integrating voice agents

  • Familiarity with task automation powered by AI

  • Strong Python background with applied AI or ML workflows

#LI-AW

Mainstay Built on Trust

At Mainstay, trust is at the core of everything we do. We build trust with everyone -- from candidates to employees to partners. We believe in fairness and openness throughout our hiring process, evaluating candidates based on qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status. Our privacy practices describe how we handle applicant information, you can find the policy details for California residents here.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, religious beliefs, or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you require assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please contact us at mainstay-recruiting@opendoor.com

jobs.title: Director of Operations Design & Strategy
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Mainstay

Mainstay is the leading market intelligence platform purpose built for buying, managing, and selling homes in the single family rental industry. As an AI native company, we turn complex data into clarity that helps the industry move forward with confidence. Founded within Opendoor, Mainstay launched as an independent company in 2024 and recently raised a Series A round led by Khosla Ventures.

Ready to shape the future of real estate with AI? Join Mainstay and help us redefine what’s possible in the single family rental space. If you thrive on solving complex problems and want to make a tangible impact in a fast-growing industry, we’d love to hear from you - apply now and let’s move the industry forward, together!

About the role

We’re hiring a Director of Operations Design & Strategy to build and scale the operating system for one of Mainstay’s business lines. You’ll report to the COO, lead a small team, and partner with Fulfillment, Product, Engineering, Analytics, and Revenue to turn strategy into shipped outcomes. You’ll mature new processes and tools to repeatability, then move on to the next priority, staying close to institutional customers and converting their needs into product and operational improvements.

In this role you will

  • Own outcomes for one business line, including KPIs such as cost per unit, cycle time, forecast accuracy, and NPS; set targets and publish variance drivers monthly.

  • Work cross functionally w/ departmental leaders to own the P&L performance of the business line

  • Run the operating cycle end to end: annual/quarterly planning, resource prioritization, OKRs, risk register, and executive readouts.

  • Stand up standard work and SOPs across markets; roll out workflow/BI/LLM-assisted tooling with training and adoption plans.
    Define the experimentation framework: success criteria, guardrails/sample sizes, decision gates, and how wins graduate to BAU.

  • Build the analytics backbone with Data: metric definitions, lineage, access controls, and a single source of truth.

  • Create mechanisms that scale: intake and triage, change management, incident playbooks, and weekly business reviews with owners and due dates.

  • Partner with Product and Engineering on roadmap trade-offs; write decision briefs with options, risks, and decision owners to secure alignment fast.

  • Lead and develop a small BizOps team; run hiring loops, calibrations, and growth plans tied to observable behaviors.

  • Meet with institutional customers regularly and convert structured insights into prioritized backlog items with owners and timelines.

What we’re looking for

  • 8-12 years in strategy/operations (or comparable experience) with 3+ years leading managers and ICs.

  • Proven business-line ownership with clear KPI accountability and real trade-offs managed.

  • Systems thinker who simplifies complexity into a few durable mechanisms and retires what no longer serves.

  • Strong judgment in uncertainty: fast on reversible calls, rigorous on irreversible ones.

  • Inclusive people leader who hires thoughtfully, sets unambiguous expectations, and develops talent.

  • Change driver with adoption at scale across teams or markets, not just pilots.

  • Data-literate decision maker; comfortable modeling in Sheets/Excel and partnering with Analytics/BI. SQL is required.

  • Executive-ready communicator who aligns Product, Engineering, Revenue, Fulfillment, and Finance.

  • Customer mindset that turns qualitative signal into prioritized outcomes.

Bonus Points

  • Experience in SFR/real estate, fintech, or logistics-heavy operations

  • Fluency in leveraging AI tools and methods for analysis and process improvement is highly recommended

This role is a great fit if

  • You enjoy designing the “operating system” for a business line: planning cadence, OKRs, dashboards, postmortems, and decision frameworks.

  • You can turn messy inputs into clear choices, then mobilize cross-functional teams to deliver outcomes on time.

  • You thrive in ambiguity, move fast with judgment, and prefer lightweight mechanisms over bureaucracy.

  • You like developing talent and creating leverage through simple standards and clear ownership.

  • You’re energized by direct exposure to customers and translating signal into product and process improvements.

Not a great fit if

  • You prefer maintaining existing processes rather than building net-new and retiring what no longer serves the business.

  • You need rigid structure and detailed instructions to get started.

  • You’re uncomfortable with data-driven trade-offs or making decisions under imperfect information.

  • You avoid hard prioritization conversations across senior stakeholders or prefer a purely IC role.


#LI-AW

Mainstay Built on Trust

At Mainstay, trust is at the core of everything we do. We build trust with everyone -- from candidates to employees to partners. We believe in fairness and openness throughout our hiring process, evaluating candidates based on qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status. Our privacy practices describe how we handle applicant information, you can find the policy details for California residents here.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, religious beliefs, or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you require assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please contact us at mainstay-recruiting@opendoor.com

jobs.title: Flex Agent - 1099 Independent Contractor (Missouri License)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Mainstay

Mainstay is the leading market intelligence platform purpose built for buying, managing, and selling homes in the single family rental industry. As an AI native company, we turn complex data into clarity that helps the industry move forward with confidence. Founded within Opendoor, Mainstay launched as an independent company in 2024 and recently raised a Series A round led by Khosla Ventures.

Ready to shape the future of real estate with AI? Join Mainstay and help us redefine what’s possible in the single family rental space. If you thrive on solving complex problems and want to make a tangible impact in a fast-growing industry, we’d love to hear from you - apply now and let’s move the industry forward, together!

About the role

Join Mainstay as a Flex Agent (1099 Independent Contractor Agent) and take control of your earning potential while providing essential real estate services. As a contractor, you will complete specific tasks on behalf of our customers, earning compensation based on the work performed. This is an ideal opportunity for licensed real estate professionals looking for flexible work, additional income, or a way to stay active in the industry without full-time commitments.

Mainstay’s Flex Agent Program allows you to leverage your expertise in real estate while maintaining full independence, choosing the tasks that best fit your schedule.

Please Note: We are actively building a pool of qualified Mainstay Flex Agents to support our customers as needs arise. Once you apply, we'll reach out when opportunities become available in the state(s) where you hold an active real estate license.

Who You Are

This role is perfect for real estate professionals who:

  • Want flexible earning opportunities – Work when and where you want by choosing the tasks that fit your schedule. 

  • Are licensed real estate agents – You must hold an active real estate license in at least one state.

  • Are detail-oriented and reliable – Ensuring all tasks meet Mainstay’s quality standards.

  • Have strong communication skills – Providing professional service to Mainstay customers.

  • Are self-motivated and proactive – Managing your own workflow and completing tasks independently.

Requirements

  • Active real estate license in at least one state

  • Experience in real estate transactions (traditional sales, iBuying, or transaction coordination preferred)

  • Ability to complete assigned tasks on time and with attention to detail

  • Strong organizational skills and ability to handle multiple transactions, and diligent documentation.

  • Strong technical skills: Salesforce or a similar CRM, G-Suite, Slack, MacOS, and the ability to work in multiple systems simultaneously

  • An ability to skilfully negotiate, seek the thrill of winning, and never give up

  • Reliable transportation (for property-related tasks such as Home Check-Ins and Lockbox Installs)

  • Access to a smartphone and computer for task completion, documentation, and communication

Compensation

As a Mainstay Flex Agent, you’ll be compensated on a per-task basis with competitive earnings tied directly to the work you complete. Tasks may include writing and negotiating offers, preparing comparative market analyses (CMAs), conducting property walk-throughs, performing weekly property checks, and managing transactions from contract to close. This pay-per-performance model allows you to earn income that reflects your contributions - offering flexibility, autonomy, and strong earning potential within a supportive operations structure.

Additional Earning Opportunities

Personal Transactions – Agents assisting their own buyers and sellers will retain 90% of the paid commission, with 10% allocated to Mainstay for licensing and administrative costs.

Why Join Mainstay as a 1099 Flex Agent?

  • Independence & Flexibility – Work on your own schedule, choosing the tasks that suit you.

  • Earn Per Task – No commission splits (except on personal transactions); you get paid for each completed task.

  • Stay Active in Real Estate – A great way to stay involved in the industry without committing to a full-time role.

  • Supplement Your Income – Whether you're a part-time agent, transitioning between jobs, or just looking for extra cash, this program allows you to generate income on demand.

Mainstay Built on Trust

At Mainstay, trust is at the core of everything we do. We build trust with everyone -- from candidates to employees to partners. We believe in fairness and openness throughout our hiring process, evaluating candidates based on qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status. Our privacy practices describe how we handle applicant information, you can find the policy details for California residents here.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, religious beliefs, or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you require assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please contact us at mainstay-recruiting@opendoor.com

What you should expect as a full-stack senior software engineer: maximum agency, tight feedback loops with customers, and no shortage of product challenges that directly translate to business value! You’ll have the opportunity to design, build, and ship complex systems and tools that enable teams to execute at scale.

We're looking for someone who can build robust, reliable, and production-ready features end to end, from backend systems and retrieval pipelines to user-facing product experiences. Our products are built with Python, TypeScript, and React on AWS.


WHAT YOU'LL DO

In this role, you'll shape solutions from the ground up - owning backend and frontend design, automating complex workflows, and directly applying user feedback. You'll help set technical direction for the team, mentor other engineers, and turn big ideas into products that create real impact for our customers and the business.

In this role, you will:

 - Contribute to all phases of product development, from ideation and prototyping to implementation and iteration.

 - Build and evolve both frontend product experiences and backend services that power them.

 - Design reliable and scalable backend services to support new features in production.

 - Modernize and automate legacy workflows in the real estate industry.

 - Define and ship useful features in partnership with cross-functional teams.

 - Mentor and support the growth of other engineers on the team.

 - Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and operators to identify and solve customer pain points.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

 - 5+ years of experience building and delivering production-grade software, ideally in fast-paced, high-growth startup environments.

 - Strong full-stack engineering skills, with a focus on backend scalability and system reliability.

 - Experience designing, building, and evolving scalable systems and services.

 - Clear, concise communicator - essential for our remote, highly collaborative team.

 - Proactive and ownership-driven - comfortable navigating ambiguity and shifting priorities.

 - Customer-focused mindset with a drive to build solutions that solve real problems.

 - Strong Python background; experience with TypeScript and React is also a plus.

 - Experience with workflow automation or complex data integration is a plus.

#LI-AW

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Mainstay

Mainstay is the leading market intelligence platform purpose built for buying, managing, and selling homes in the single family rental industry. As an AI native company, we turn complex data into clarity that helps the industry move forward with confidence. Founded within Opendoor, Mainstay launched as an independent company in 2024 and recently raised a Series A round led by Khosla Ventures.

Ready to shape the future of real estate with AI? Join Mainstay and help us redefine what’s possible in the single family rental space. If you thrive on solving complex problems and want to make a tangible impact in a fast-growing industry, we’d love to hear from you - apply now and let’s move the industry forward, together!

About the role

As a Senior Data Engineer on the Data Platform team, you will be responsible for building data products in partnership with our data science and product teams. This is a rare opportunity where your data engineering output will be the shipped product and not just an internal resource. Our customers are businesses operating in the single-family home market and our goal is to provide them with high quality data to inform underwriting, leasing, vendor management, and more. We’re a small team dedicated to quality engineering and are looking for a technical leader to help us evolve our products and establish best practices.

In this role, you will:

  • Architect durable data models with intuitive representations of residential real estate

  • Design graceful and reliable workflows to generate data assets

  • Inform the overall architecture of our data platform

  • Establish standards and best practices for data engineering

  • Become a domain expert in real estate

We're looking for someone with:

  • 6+ years of experience working in data engineering or software engineering

  • Expertise in data architecture, data modeling, and building data pipelines at scale

  • Proficiency in SQL, Python, and/or Spark

  • Expertise in cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery

  • Experience scheduling and operating batch data processing workflows

Bonus points if you have:

  • Airflow, Prefect, Dagster, or a similar orchestration system

  • Data Warehouse (DWH) architecture and Change Data Capture (CDC) modeling techniques

  • Web scraping and data extraction from public or semi-structured sources

  • Experience with AI/ML platforms such as SageMaker, MLflow, or similar

  • Hands-on experience managing data platform infrastructure, with proficiency in tools such as Terraform, Docker, and AWS services

Benefits Package (for full-time employees only):

  • Paid time off and 12 paid holidays annually

  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance

  • Basic life insurance

  • 401(k) retirement plan

#LI-AW

Mainstay Built on Trust

At Mainstay, trust is at the core of everything we do. We build trust with everyone -- from candidates to employees to partners. We believe in fairness and openness throughout our hiring process, evaluating candidates based on qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status. Our privacy practices describe how we handle applicant information, you can find the policy details for California residents here.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, religious beliefs, or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you require assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please contact us at mainstay-recruiting@opendoor.com

jobs.title: Flex Agent - 1099 Independent Contractor
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Mainstay

Mainstay is the leading market intelligence platform purpose built for buying, managing, and selling homes in the single family rental industry. As an AI native company, we turn complex data into clarity that helps the industry move forward with confidence. Founded within Opendoor, Mainstay launched as an independent company in 2024 and recently raised a Series A round led by Khosla Ventures.

Ready to shape the future of real estate with AI? Join Mainstay and help us redefine what’s possible in the single family rental space. If you thrive on solving complex problems and want to make a tangible impact in a fast-growing industry, we’d love to hear from you - apply now and let’s move the industry forward, together!

About the role

Join Mainstay as a Flex Agent (1099 Independent Contractor Agent) and take control of your earning potential while providing essential real estate services. As a contractor, you will complete specific tasks on behalf of our customers, earning compensation based on the work performed. This is an ideal opportunity for licensed real estate professionals looking for flexible work, additional income, or a way to stay active in the industry without full-time commitments.

Mainstay’s Flex Agent Program allows you to leverage your expertise in real estate while maintaining full independence, choosing the tasks that best fit your schedule.

Please Note: We are actively building a pool of qualified Mainstay Flex Agents to support our customers as needs arise. Once you apply, we'll reach out when opportunities become available in the state(s) where you hold an active real estate license.

Who You Are

This role is perfect for real estate professionals who:

  • Want flexible earning opportunities – Work when and where you want by choosing the tasks that fit your schedule. 

  • Are licensed real estate agents – You must hold an active real estate license in at least one state.

  • Are detail-oriented and reliable – Ensuring all tasks meet Mainstay’s quality standards.

  • Have strong communication skills – Providing professional service to Mainstay customers.

  • Are self-motivated and proactive – Managing your own workflow and completing tasks independently.

Requirements

  • Active real estate license in at least one state

  • Experience in real estate transactions (traditional sales, iBuying, or transaction coordination preferred)

  • Ability to complete assigned tasks on time and with attention to detail

  • Strong organizational skills and ability to handle multiple transactions, and diligent documentation.

  • Strong technical skills: Salesforce or a similar CRM, G-Suite, Slack, MacOS, and the ability to work in multiple systems simultaneously

  • An ability to skilfully negotiate, seek the thrill of winning, and never give up

  • Reliable transportation (for property-related tasks such as Home Check-Ins and Lockbox Installs)

  • Access to a smartphone and computer for task completion, documentation, and communication

Compensation

As a Mainstay Flex Agent, you’ll be compensated on a per-task basis with competitive earnings tied directly to the work you complete. Tasks may include writing and negotiating offers, preparing comparative market analyses (CMAs), conducting property walk-throughs, performing weekly property checks, and managing transactions from contract to close. This pay-per-performance model allows you to earn income that reflects your contributions - offering flexibility, autonomy, and strong earning potential within a supportive operations structure.

Additional Earning Opportunities

Personal Transactions – Agents assisting their own buyers and sellers will retain 90% of the paid commission, with 10% allocated to Mainstay for licensing and administrative costs.

Why Join Mainstay as a 1099 Flex Agent?

  • Independence & Flexibility – Work on your own schedule, choosing the tasks that suit you.

  • Earn Per Task – No commission splits (except on personal transactions); you get paid for each completed task.

  • Stay Active in Real Estate – A great way to stay involved in the industry without committing to a full-time role.

  • Supplement Your Income – Whether you're a part-time agent, transitioning between jobs, or just looking for extra cash, this program allows you to generate income on demand.

Mainstay Built on Trust

At Mainstay, trust is at the core of everything we do. We build trust with everyone -- from candidates to employees to partners. We believe in fairness and openness throughout our hiring process, evaluating candidates based on qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status. Our privacy practices describe how we handle applicant information, you can find the policy details for California residents here.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, religious beliefs, or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you require assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please contact us at mainstay-recruiting@opendoor.com

This pay-per-performance model allows you to earn income that reflects your contributions - offering flexibility, autonomy, and strong earning potential within a supportive operations structure.

Additional Earning Opportunities

Personal Transactions – Agents assisting their own buyers and sellers will retain 90% of the paid commission, with 10% allocated to Mainstay for licensing and administrative costs.


WHY JOIN MAINSTAY AS A 1099 FLEX AGENT?

 - Independence & Flexibility – Work on your own schedule, choosing the tasks that suit you.

 - Earn Per Task – No commission splits (except on personal transactions); you get paid for each completed task.

 - Stay Active in Real Estate – A great way to stay involved in the industry without committing to a full-time role.

 - Supplement Your Income – Whether you're a part-time agent, transitioning between jobs, or just looking for extra cash, this program allows you to generate income on demand.


MAINSTAY BUILT ON TRUST

At Mainstay, trust is at the core of everything we do. We build trust with everyone -- from candidates to employees to partners. We believe in fairness and openness throughout our hiring process, evaluating candidates based on qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status.   • An ability to skilfully negotiate, seek the thrill of winning, and never give up

Mainstay Built on Trust

At Mainstay, trust is at the core of everything we do. We build trust with everyone -- from candidates to employees to partners. We believe in fairness and openness throughout our hiring process, evaluating candidates based on qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status. jobs.title: Senior Ops Design & Strategy Associate
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Mainstay

Mainstay is the leading market intelligence platform purpose built for buying, managing, and selling homes in the single family rental industry. As an AI native company, we turn complex data into clarity that helps the industry move forward with confidence. Founded within Opendoor, Mainstay launched as an independent company in 2024 and recently raised a Series A round led by Khosla Ventures.

Ready to shape the future of real estate with AI? Join Mainstay and help us redefine what’s possible in the single family rental space. If you thrive on solving complex problems and want to make a tangible impact in a fast-growing industry, we’d love to hear from you - apply now and let’s move the industry forward, together!

About the role

We’re hiring two Senior Ops Design & Strategy Associate - one to support our HOA product and one to support our Tax product. Both products are core to Mainstay’s platform, which serves institutional single-family rental investors managing thousands of homes across fragmented markets.

Each associate will play a critical role in shaping how their product operates and scales - partnering with Product, Engineering, and Operations to design the systems, processes, and insights that make our platform seamless for customers. Whether you’re optimizing collection of dues across hundreds of HOAs or streamlining the processing of millions of dollars in property tax payments, your work will transform complex, manual processes into efficient, data-driven systems.

In this role you will

  • Own performance outcomes for either the HOA or Tax product line, identifying friction in workflows and driving improvements that make the system faster and more reliable

  • Facilitate building models and dashboards to diagnose performance trends and guide data-driven decisions

  • Partner with Product Managers to translate operational insights into feature ideas and process changes that improve automation, customer experience and scalability

  • Create and refine processes that let Mainstay onboard new institutional partners efficiently and operate at scale without unnecessary complexity

  • Coordinate with Product, Engineering, and Operations to align priorities, deliver results, and measure impact

  • Track and report the results of new initiatives, sharing insights and influencing roadmap and process priorities

  • Keep pushing for better by spotting new opportunities, proposing fixes, and taking ownership of getting them implemented

What we're looking for

  • 5+ years of professional experience in business operations, business consulting, product operations, project management, sales operations

  • A history of solving complex problems quickly and independently - you know how to prioritize, figure things out, and get results

  • Strong analytical and technical skills. Excel experience is required. Experience with SQL is highly preferred.

  • A process minded approach paired with flexibility - you care about precision but can adapt when things move fast

  • Clear, confident communication. You can break down complex ideas and work easily with both technical and non-technical teammates

  • A strong sense of ownership and accountability. You move quickly, take initiative, and consistently deliver high quality work

  • A bias for action and a “no problem is too small” attitude

Bonus points for

  • You have an interest in real estate; residential real estate experience

  • Fluency in leveraging AI tools and methods for analysis and process improvement is highly recommended

  • Startup experience preferred

This role is a great fit if

  • You enjoy turning messy, ambiguous problems into clear systems and processes that actually work

  • You’re comfortable operating with limited direction and like taking ownership from idea to execution

  • You think in both numbers and narratives - able to analyze data, but also explain what it means for the business

  • You like working cross-functionally and can build strong partnerships with Product, Engineering, and Operations teams

  • You’re motivated by impact and want to see your work directly improve how a product runs and how customers experience it

  • You’re energized by change and growth - you like joining a company in motion

Not a great fit if

  • You prefer steady-state environments with fixed processes and long timelines

  • You need clearly defined instructions before taking action

  • You see your role as “support” rather than “ownership”

  • You’re uncomfortable working across different functions or switching contexts quickly

  • You value perfection over progress - you’d rather get it exactly right than get it moving

#LI-AW

Mainstay Built on Trust

At Mainstay, trust is at the core of everything we do. We build trust with everyone -- from candidates to employees to partners. We believe in fairness and openness throughout our hiring process, evaluating candidates based on qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status. Our privacy practices describe how we handle applicant information, you can find the policy details for California residents here.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, religious beliefs, or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you require assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please contact us at mainstay-recruiting@opendoor.com

jobs.title: Staff Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Mainstay

Mainstay is the leading market intelligence platform purpose built for buying, managing, and selling homes in the single family rental industry. As an AI native company, we turn complex data into clarity that helps the industry move forward with confidence. Founded within Opendoor, Mainstay launched as an independent company in 2024 and recently raised a Series A round led by Khosla Ventures.

Ready to shape the future of real estate with AI? Join Mainstay and help us redefine what’s possible in the single family rental space. If you thrive on solving complex problems and want to make a tangible impact in a fast-growing industry, we’d love to hear from you - apply now and let’s move the industry forward, together!

About the role


As a Staff Product Designer, you will begin by owning design work in one product area, building deep expertise and driving high quality outcomes. Over time, your initiatives will influence and shape experiences across multiple product areas, improving usability, efficiency, and business impact at scale. You will partner with product managers, engineers, and leadership to turn vision into experiences that scale. You will also help define how AI and emerging technologies are applied responsibly and creatively in our product.

As part of our interview process, you’ll complete a short, paid work trial that reflects how we actually collaborate at Mainstay. You can read more about how we approach work trials here

In this role you will

  • Lead the design strategy and execution for one or more core product workstreams.

  • Collaborate with product, engineering, and other partners to translate business needs into clear, scalable user experiences.

  • Conduct user research and synthesize insights to inform design direction.

  • Create prototypes and high-fidelity mockups in Figma that communicate design intent effectively.

  • Extend and evolve our design system to improve consistency and efficiency.

  • Mentor designers and help shape Mainstay’s design culture.

  • Explore how AI and automation can thoughtfully enhance user experience and workflow efficiency.

What we’re looking for

  • 8+ years of experience designing and shipping digital products, ideally in SaaS or complex system environments.

  • Strong product thinking. You connect user needs, business goals, and technical realities into clear, effective design solutions.

  • Mastery of interaction and visual design. You care about details and know when to simplify.

  • Experience leading design work from discovery to launch — setting direction, aligning teams, and iterating with intent.

  • Clear communicator who can explain decisions and guide discussions with empathy and precision.

  • Comfortable working in fast-moving, collaborative environments. You stay grounded and organized amid change.

  • Genuine curiosity about how emerging technologies, including AI, can improve product experiences.

  • Excitement for mentoring and helping others grow. You raise the quality bar and bring others with you.

This role is a great fit if…

  • You enjoy shaping ideas with others and believe collaboration makes the work stronger.

  • You move easily between big-picture systems thinking and hands-on design craft.

  • You value clarity - in your work, your communication, and how you make decisions.

  • You can work independently, manage your time well, and follow through on commitments.

  • You’re motivated by meaningful problems and want to see your designs make a real impact.

Not a great fit if…

  • You prefer rigid structures or highly defined processes before you start designing.

  • You’re uncomfortable sharing unfinished work or receiving feedback early and often.

  • You prefer working solo and find cross-functional collaboration draining.

  • You’re looking for short-term contract work rather than a long-term, full-time opportunity.

Interview Process

We aim to keep the process clear, respectful of your time, and true to how we work.

Here’s what to expect:

  1. Application - Submit your resume and portfolio.

  2. Team Portfolio Review - Our design team reviews submissions to identify strong fits.

  3. Recruiter Call (30 min) - brief conversation to learn more about you and share details about Mainstay.

  4. Portfolio Interview (60 min) - deeper discussion of one or two projects that show your process and impact.

  5. Paid Work Trial (1 week) - short, collaborative project that reflects real Mainstay work.

  6. Debrief & Offer Discussion - exchange feedback, answer questions, and discuss next steps together.

We’ll communicate clearly at each step so you always know what’s coming next.

#LI-AW

Mainstay Built on Trust

At Mainstay, trust is at the core of everything we do. We build trust with everyone -- from candidates to employees to partners. We believe in fairness and openness throughout our hiring process, evaluating candidates based on qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status. Our privacy practices describe how we handle applicant information, you can find the policy details for California residents here.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations throughout our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, religious beliefs, or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you require assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please contact us at mainstay-recruiting@opendoor.com
